doc.after: Generally wary of people in the forest or countryside, western jackdaws are much tamer in urban areas.[53] Like magpies,[54] they are known to pick up shiny objects such as jewellery to hoard in nests.[55] John Gay, in his Beggar's Opera, notes that "A covetous fellow, like a jackdaw, steals what he was never made to enjoy, for the sake of hiding it".[56] In Tobias Smollett's The Expedition of Humphry Clinker, a scathing character assassination runs, "He is ungracious as a hog, greedy as a vulture, and thievish as a jackdaw."[57]
